questions.question_text: IT senior management has just received a survey report indicating that more than one third of the organization's key IT staff plan to retire within the next 12 months. Which of the following is the MOST important governance action to prepare for this possibility?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Include the discussion of key enterprise risk as an agenda item at board meetings.

Including the discussion of key enterprise risks as a regular agenda item at board meetings ensures that risk management receives attention at the highest levels of the organization. Board meetings provide a forum for strategic discussions and decisions, and by including risk management as a recurring agenda item, the CEO can ensure that risk events are addressed proactively rather than reactively.

This approach not only emphasizes the importance of risk management to the entire organization but also ensures that the C-suite is regularly informed about potential risks and their implications for the enterprise.

Understanding the enterprise's risk tolerance involves comprehending the level of risk that the organization is willing to accept in pursuit of its objectives.
